newsitem.title: JAPAN: Idemitsu Kosan puts advanced desulphuriser on line.
newsitem.headline: Idemitsu Kosan puts advanced desulphuriser on line.

text.p: Idemitsu Kosan Co Ltd said on Wednesday it had brought a 25,000 barrels-per-day (bpd) advanced desulphurisation unit on line at its 130,000 bpd refinery in Japan's northernmost main island of Hokkaido.
The five billion yen unit can cut sulphur content in gas oil to below 0.05 percent, an Idemitsu spokesman said.
The government is to lower the maximum allowable sulphur content in gas oil to 0.05 percent in October 1997 from the current 0.2 percent.
Idemitsu will install similar units at its 160,000 bpd Aichi refinery in central Japan and its 120,000 bpd Tokuyama plant in western Japan by the end of this year, he said.
